solution_line_template: Mia spent a total of ${cost_per_sibling} per siblings * {num_siblings} siblings = $<<{cost_per_sibling}*{num_siblings}={spent_on_siblings}>>{spent_on_siblings} on her siblings.
She therefore spent ${total_spending} total spending - ${spent_on_siblings} spending on her siblings = $<<{total_spending}-{spent_on_siblings}={spent_on_parents}>>{spent_on_parents} on her parents.

As each parent received an equal amount, each parent's gift cost ${spent_on_parents} total spending on parents / {num_parents} = $<<{spent_on_parents}/{num_parents}={cost_per_parent_gift}>>{cost_per_parent_gift}.
